required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of iGlarLixi Versus Insulin Glargine Plus Dulaglutide in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of iGlarLixi Versus Insulin Glargine Plus Dulaglutide in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Insufficiently Controlled by Insulin Glargine and Metformin Combination Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators aimed to compare efficacy and safety of IGlarLixi and insulin glargine plus dulaglutide as intensification from basal insulin with metformin, in the absence of head-to-head trials.

detailed_description.textblock: Fixed-dose combinations of insulin glargine/lixisenatide (IGlarLixi) or insulin glargine plus dulaglutide constitute treatment intensification in type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2D). The investigators aimed to compare efficacy and safety of IGlarLixi and insulin glargine plus dulaglutide as intensification from basal insulin with metformin, in the absence of head-to-head trials. Treatments were compared in terms of glycated hemoglobin (HbA1c), fasting plasma glucose (FPG) change from baseline, and variables from continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) system; in addition to safety issues on hypoglycemia and changes in weight.

primary_outcome.description: HbA1c will be measured at baseline and week 12

secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of FPG changes in week 12 from baseline between the two groups

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in glucose time in range (TIR)
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of %TIR changes in week 12 from baseline between the two groups

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in glucose time above range (TAR)
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of %TAR changes in week 12 from baseline between the two groups

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in glucose time below range (TBR)
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of %TBR changes in week 12 from baseline between the two groups
Comparison of the incidence of hypoglycemia between the two groups
Comparison of weight changes in week 12 from baseline between the two

arm_group.description: Switching to IGlarLixi from insulin glargine iGlar/Lixi starts with the following doses depending on the existing insulin glargine dose: 1) insulin glargine <20 unit/day = iGlar/Lixi 10 unit/day, 2) insulin glargine >=20 unit/day = iGlar/Lixi 20 unit/day. Training to increase the iGlar/Lixi dosage every 3 days to meet the target fasting blood glucose level to 80~130 mg/day
Adding Dulaglutide to insulin glargine. Keep insulin glargine and dulaglutide start at 0.75 mg per week and increase to 1.5 mg per week after 1 month with evaluating compliance and tolerability.

intervention.description: Changing to iGlarLixi from insulin glargine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age â‰¥ 18 years old
- Patient with type 2 diabetes, treated with basal insulin plus metformin (maximum tolerated dosage) for at least 12 weeks
- Patient accepting to participant to this study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or breastfeeding woman
- severe renal dysfunction (eGFR <60 ml/min/1.73m2)
- chronic or acute hepatic disorder (HBV or HCV hepatitis, liver cirrhosis etc.) (AST/ALT > 2.5*ULN)
- Prescription such as immunosuppressant agents, glucocorticoids
- Active anti-cancer treatment
